title: Bug 49536: Accessing a URL in Tomcat 7 with no webapps returns 200 OK with no content instead of 404
description: Upon accessing a URL in Tomcat 7 with no webapps deployed, it currently returns an HTTP code 200 OK with no content, instead of returning an HTTP error 404.
OB: When a Tomcat 7 instance is started with no webapps deployed and a URL is accessed, the server returns an HTTP code 200 OK with no content.
EB: The expected behavior is that when a URL is accessed in Tomcat 7 with no webapps deployed, the server should return an HTTP error 404, indicating that the requested resource is not found.
SR:
To reproduce: 
1. Download the Tomcat 7 distribution from http://mirror.veriportal.com/apache/tomcat/tomcat7/v7.0.0beta/bin/apachetomcat7.0.0.zip 
2. Start a Tomcat 7 instance without deploying any webapps 
3. Access a URL on the server and observe the server response code
